title: Adjectives (Good, Bad, Big, Small).
reading_greek: Ο σκύλος είναι καλός. Η γάτα είναι μικρή. Το σπίτι είναι μεγάλο. Το φαγητό είναι κακό.
reading_english: The dog is good. The cat is small. The house is big. The food is bad.
audio_script: Welcome to Week 6... Today we're learning four very useful adjectives: Good, Bad, Big, and Small... Remember that in Greek, adjectives change based on the gender of the noun they describe... We will focus on the masculine forms (ending in -ος), the feminine forms (ending in -η or -α), and the neutral forms (ending in -ο)... For 'Good', we have καλός, καλή, καλό... For 'Bad', we have κακός, κακή, κακό... For 'Big', we have μεγάλος, μεγάλη, μεγάλο... And for 'Small', we have μικρός, μικρή, μικρό... Listen carefully to the examples in the reading... [Reading Greek]... Ο σκύλος είναι καλός... Η γάτα είναι μικρή... Το σπίτι είναι μεγάλο... Το φαγητό είναι κακό... Now, let's practice the vocabulary... Listen and repeat: Good (masculine), καλός... Good (feminine), καλή... Good (neutral), καλό... Big (neutral), μεγάλο... Small (feminine), μικρή... Great job... Let's read the passage one more time: [Reading Greek]...
